column4: using xubuntu...cpu speed in BIOS reads correct, 1.6ghz, but in linux via cat /proc/cpuinfo and conky it reads 1.2ghz. windows reds correctly
lol im at 61C
do you have cpufreqd or something similar installed?
i will in a moment
ok now what?
=) I thought that if you had cpufreqd installed, you might have had a profile running that limited the speed of your cpu
oh no i dont. can i use it to set the clock correctly?
I use cpufreqd to throttle my cpu to 60% speed so it doesn't get too hot
maybe another daemon was throttling your cpu speed (forget the name, it's installed by default w/ ubuntu)
brb, sec please
with a default /etc/cpufreqd.conf your cpu should be set to 100% speed while on AC
I would try rebooting, then check for a running cpufreqd (ps ax | grep cpufreqd) and check /proc/cpuinfo again
ahhh AC is plugged in and conky states 1.6
what was the expected value again?
it's a 1.6p4 m that was running at 1.2
so conky states 1.6 ... what about /proc/cpuinfo?
1.6ghz
guess that means theres another reason wqhy this thing kind of chugs
if you want to monitor your cpu speed over a period of time you can do: watch grep \"cpu MHz\" /proc/cpuinfo
thanks i will
good luck
